message: the url you get back is cloneable
This is an example of the json I get back:
I'm testing a small app that accesses the oauth API for repositories at `api/v2/json/repos/show/<user>`, and I'm not finding a clonable url in the results

u 'repositories': [{
    u 'fork': True,
    u 'has_wiki': True,
    u 'description': u 'Activity Streams Library for Perl',
    u 'has_downloads': True,
    u 'url': u 'https://github.com/sivy/activity-streams-perl',
    u 'created_at': u '2010/08/09 07:38:58 -0700',
    u 'private': False,
    u 'name': u 'activity-streams-perl',
    u 'pushed_at': u '2010/08/17 07:38:32 -0700',
    u 'owner': u 'sivy',
    u 'watchers': 2,
    u 'open_issues': 0,
    u 'has_issues': False,
    u 'forks': 1,
    u 'homepage': u '',
    u 'size': 704
},
I suppose I could put together a clonable URL based on the username and reponame, but though I'd see if there was a way to get a proper cloneable URL via the api?
I knew there was a cloneable https url, but I hadn't realized that it was the same as the general repo url
@kneath - is it possible to "browse" a repo via the api? like, look for a file and get it's contents?
I know it's a little crazy, but i'm trying to access a repo via the api, and see if a config file exists in the repo, and read it
perhaps a bad way to go, but that's the idea
ah, yes, i see that you can get the data for a blog
